jobDescription:
Who We Are



TempStars is the leading dental temping and hiring technology-powered marketplace in North America, connecting over 10,000 dental offices with more than 21,000 dental professionals.


Our platform provides a streamlined and efficient way for dental offices to post temping shifts and permanent job positions, with customizable hourly rates and role requirements.


Dental professionals can easily search and offer their services at their preferred rates. With a user-centric approach and a robust review and performance management system, TempStars has achieved over 97% satisfaction among dental offices.


TempStars is the leader and innovator in the dental temping and hiring space, with an adventurous and early-adopter spirit and risk tolerance to push the envelope of technology.


Role Description



This is a full-time hybrid role for an expert Full Stack Engineer located in Toronto, ON. The role includes both office and remote work. As a Full Stack Engineer, you will be responsible for back-end and front-end web and mobile development to build and iterate on our successful and growing platform.


Who You Are



You are located in Ontario with the ability to meet regularly in the GTA, for in-person collaboration, as a hybrid remote and in-person (2 days per week) position.


You are seasoned and experienced in React, Cordova, Framework 7, Vue.js, Node.js, and SQL with a portfolio to match. Experience is mid-level DevOps for AWS infrastructure is a plus.


An enthusiastic and early adopter of A.I. tools and capabilities - both from an internal productivity standpoint, and for implementing A.I. to provide delightful user value in UI/UX.


Motivated by TempStars' mission to improve the work lives of dental professionals and driven by the core values of trustworthiness, data-informed decisions, and growth learning & adaptation.


Qualifications

Strong skills in Back-End Web Development, Front-End Development, and Full-Stack Development
HTML, JavaScript, CSS, React
Node.js, React, Apache Cordova, SQL
AWS (EC2, RDS, S3)
Experience in web and mobile application development (iOS & Android)
Knowledge of programming languages such as JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
Experience with A.I. api calls and coding assistants is a bonus
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Strong communication and documentation skills
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field


Why TempStars?



Become part of a team led by a practicing dentist and thought leader in the dental industry, and contribute to a product that boasts over 500,000 hours of shifts filled and improves the dental work experience across North America, making a positive impact on the work lives of dental professionals.


Take advantage of the opportunity to work with a company on the leading edge of innovations that values direct connections, transparency, and community, in a rewarding environment where innovation is encouraged, and your work directly impacts the lives of thousands.


How to Apply



We'd ask that interested candidates apply only if you live in the Greater Toronto Area and are able to meet regularly in person for collaborative work. 



Please submit your resume, a brief cover letter explaining your interest and how you align with TempStars' mission and values, and any relevant portfolio items or GitHub links.


We're looking forward to meeting a developer who's not just looking for a job, but a meaningful career on the innovative edge for web and mobile technology, improving the lives of those in the dental profession.
techSkillsArr: web and mobile application development (iOS & Android)
A.I. api calls and coding assistants is a bonus
work collaboratively in a team environment

jobDescription:
Software Developer Co-Op (Capture)

Location: Vancouver, BC 

Expected Start Date: Sept 2024

Length: 8 - month Co-Op term 

As one of BC’s Top Employers (2023), Canada’s Top Growing Companies (2023), and Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2023), Copperleaf is a dynamic and disruptive high-tech organization offering exciting opportunities for growth and innovation.

Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, Copperleaf is building a better world, one decision at a time. The Copperleaf Decision Analytics Solution helps some of the world’s largest firms make better strategic decisions through data analytics and optimization. We have a track record of delivering award-winning, industry-changing solutions. Join our team as we continue to enable our clients to build more resilient and sustainable infrastructure.

The Opportunity:

We are looking for a talented Software Developer Co-op to join our Capture Team; a cross-functional team of collaborative, enthusiastic, and supportive individuals dedicated to delivering exceptional value to our clients. Currently, the team is focused on spearheading an exciting new initiative to complement Copperleaf's current offerings.

You’ll be responsible for:

Collaborating with team members on planning, design, development, code reviews, and testing.
Contributing to the development of new features, shared components, and maintenance of existing features.
Working on a variety of tasks to help the team meet delivery goals.
Working with team members to discover ways to continually improve, from our products to our team processes.
What experience will you gain?

This position provides an excellent opportunity to gain exposure to the following:

Developing sophisticated, web-based applications with a C# and Oracle relational database.
Design, implementation, review, and testing of software components.
Development of both server-side and web UI components.
Front-end development technologies (HTML5, Angular, CSS3, TypeScript, and RESTful APIs).
Using AI tools to support your programming and overall work experience.
Unit, Integration, and End-to-end Automated Testing, as well as manual quality assurance.
Coding best practices.
Working in a cross-functional team.
Agile Methodologies (Scrum)
About You:

You have the following background, but we also recognize that talent comes in many forms:

You are a 3rd or 4th year computing science or engineering student with previous software development experience.
You have experience with object-oriented languages, relational databases, web technologies and front-end components.
You have experience with source control (Git) and programming languages such as TypeScript, C#, HTML, CSS.
You are self-motivated, flexible, pragmatic, proactive, and able to handle a variety of tasks.
You are a great team member and have interpersonal skills including teamwork, respect, courtesy, and discretion.
You are curious to learn and open to sharing your ideas.
You have strong written and verbal communication skills with experience working in a team environment.
We're not hung up on how much experience you may have with a specific programming language or technology. However, we like to see skill, passion and creativity in the work and projects you've completed.

What are we looking for?

Here are some tips about what our hiring managers look for during Co-Op recruitment. 

A well-written cover letter (recommended) - We use cover letters to learn more about you and how your skills, knowledge, and experience make you a good candidate for our role and our company. This is your chance to stand out and help us see who you are beyond what you can list on a resume. 
Extracurricular activities (optional) - If you are involved in extra-curricular activities, please share them in your resume and cover letter. Hearing about these allows us to understand more about who you are. 
Transcripts (optional) - Just like extracurricular activities, if you have one feel free to upload yours. Non-official transcripts are perfect. We know there's more to like than grades, but they're part of the picture. 
A bespoke application (required) - At Copperleaf, we love artificial intelligence. In fact, we have our own in-house AI tools and strongly encourage our teams to utilize them! However, we're not looking for AI-generated cover letters and resumes. We want to see your writing style and learn more about you. Note, we don't use AI for reviewing resumes and applications. 
What Our Co-ops Are Saying

"Copperleaf provided me with an excellent overall co-op experience. The job involved a wide variety of interesting challenges as well as great people to work with and learn from. I would highly recommend considering Copperleaf for a rewarding and memorable work term."

-Jeff, previous Software Developer Co-op

"As a software developer co-op student with Copperleaf, I was able to rapidly learn and hone a variety of skills. My co-workers provided an enriching working and learning environment, and I was also given a great amount of independence on the projects I completed."

-Yuqing, previous Software Developer Co-op

"I enjoyed my co-op work term here a lot. I had the opportunity to work on a complete feature from server-side functionality to front-end functionality. When I first started at Copperleaf, I was eased into the role with relevant tasks and training that allowed me to build my knowledge on the application before diving into more complicated problems and tasks. I was also able to work with a great team of people. Everyone is very friendly and eager to help or provide suggestions to improve the application from both a development and user perspective. We also knew how to have fun with foosball tournaments and pizza parties. I am thankful I had the opportunity to work in such an amazing environment!"

Engineering @ Wealthsimple

Wealthsimple has several engineering teams ranging from product-focused to back-office and our teams build and manage the software that powers our services. We do this using microservice architecture and an agile approach, focused on short iterations and rigorous automated testing, deploying our code over 100 times a day. We maximize our productivity by building high-performing teams and giving them autonomy to deliver results, working very closely with product management, design and operations to make sure that our work delivers maximum benefit for our clients.

Interns @ Wealthsimple are completely integrated into the teams they join and get to work on meaningful projects during their time with us! For Fall 2024, we're looking to add Frontend, Full Stack, and Backend Engineers to our growing teams! Throughout the interview process, we'll learn more about your skills and interests to match you with the right team at Wealthsimple.

We're looking for people who:

Are driven to ship frequently
Take ownership in working on projects to successful completion
Enjoy tackling new, complex challenges on a regular basis
Are comfortable with self-directed learning
Believe that debate, inclusivity and transparency result in better products
Are eager to learn from your team and others. We value making one another successful!


Things you should know about our tech before applying:

We have a microservice architecture with over 100+ services in production
Roughly half of these services are Ruby on Rails, with the other half being Java/Kotlin
Our frontend application is a mix of React/Angular
We host our services on AWS and use things like RDS, Aurora, SQS, SNS, S3, Kafka, etc
We follow best practices and have great tools for profiling, logging, tracing, tracking and experimenting


What you can expect from the interview process 👀

First Interview: 45-minute technical interview (in your language of choice) with one interviewer
Second Interview: 1-hour interview with a hiring manager where you will be walking through a project review
Last Stage: Offer! 🎉 


Applications close on May 13th, 5pm EST.

About the job
Job Posting: Frontend Developer (Full-Time Contract Position)



Company: Matrica Consulting


Position Type: Full-Time, Contract


About Matrica Consulting:

Matrica Consulting is a software consultancy focusing on front-end architecture and development. With a small but growing team of highly experienced professionals, this project combines years of expertise across the full spectrum of technologies, creating an exciting opportunity to work with some of the most recognizable brands in the world. As we progress on a large, multi-year project, we are looking for a Frontend Developer to join our dynamic team. This is your chance to be part of a cutting-edge environment that operates with the agility and excitement of a startup.



Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement front-end web applications with React and TypeScript, ensuring high performance and responsiveness.
Work closely with our experienced team to integrate frontend elements with backend logic and functionalities.
Adapt to shifting roles and responsibilities in our versatile environment, echoing the fluidity and fast pace of a startup.
Engage in the entire software development life cycle, from concept to deployment and beyond.
Essential Skills & Experience:

Proficient in React, TypeScript, and State Management frameworks.
Demonstrated experience in building responsive and scalable web applications.
Ability to produce clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
Familiarity with embedded development would be an asset.
Familiarity with a broad range of technologies and a willingness to learn and adapt.
Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent professional experience.
Proven ability to thrive in a startup-like environment, handling various responsibilities as needed.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and ability to meet tight deadlines.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative spirit.
What We Offer:

A role within a small team of seasoned experts, offering vast learning opportunities.
Involvement in a significant, multi-year project.
A dynamic, fast-paced work environment that fosters creativity and innovation.
Competitive compensation.
How to Apply:

We invite you to apply by sending your resume and a cover letter detailing your React and TypeScript experience to mark@matrica.ca.

About the job
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

About the Role: Grade Level (for internal use): 08 The Team: Data & Insights (DI) is part of the S&P Global Market Intelligence division. We offer the most comprehensive company-level information, reference data, market data, valuation services and derived analytics across public and private markets. Responsibilities and Impact: As part of a global team, you will be responsible for the design, architecture, and development of software solutions using a variety of tools and technologies which continue to evolve as we explore new innovations. Develop tools, applications and business solutions with clean, high quality and efficient code Use best practices that enhance user experience, usability, scalability, performance and security Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical partners Collaborate effectively with global team members in order to remove blockers and expedite individual tasks What We’re Looking For: Basic Required Qualifications: A bachelor’s degree completed no later than June 2024 in Computer Science Thorough understanding of fundamental software engineering and computer science principles: object-oriented design, structured design, databases, algorithms, data structures, usability, refactoring, debugging, and configuration management. Excellent design and problem solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proactive and able to work independently to complete tasks. Open-minded, flexible, and able to adapt to changing situations. Additional Preferred Qualifications: An affinity for any of Java, Python, React, Angular, SQL or AWS development is a plus. About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence. What’s In It For You? Our Purpose: Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world. Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress. Our People: We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all. From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference. Our Values: Integrity, Discovery, Partnership At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals. Benefits: We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global. Our benefits include: Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body. Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on. Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills. Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs. Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families. Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference. For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global: At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all. ----------------------------------------------------------- Equal Opportunity Employer S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.  US Candidates Only: The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. ----------------------------------------------------------- 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), IFTECH203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group), SWP Priority – Ratings - (Strategic Workforce Planning) Job ID: 301873 Posted On: 2024-05-09 Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada

About the job
Country

Canada

Location: 

LOC13089: 366 Adelaide Street West, Suite 301 Toronto, ON M5V 1R9

About Carrier

Carrier is the leading global provider of healthy, safe, and sustainable building and cold chain solutions. With a world-class, diverse workforce and business segments covering HVAC, refrigeration, fire, and security, we make modern life possible by delivering safer, more innovative, and sustainable services that benefit people and our planet while revolutionizing industry trends - this is why we come to work every day. Join us, and we can make a difference together.

About BrokerBay

BrokerBay is an advanced cloud-based showing management ecosystem designed to replace the clunky legacy systems previously used by brokerages across North America. We are on a mission to consolidate, automate, and revolutionize the way brokerages do business from start to finish with:

Integrated lockbox management and showing configuration platform.
Advanced front desk and appointment management 
Customized offer strategy and feedback collection 
Modern inter-office messaging 
Actionable analytics 

The result? A smooth, hassle-free experience for admins, agents, and their clients.

Our Supra Powers 

Our parent company, Supra Systems, is the leading source of access solutions, including lockboxes used by real estate agents. Expanding our showing management platform to integrate with the Supra lockbox customers is critical to our current project roadmap. Our combined products are rapidly growing in the US and Canadian markets.

We offer

Challenging opportunities on a rapidly growing web and mobile platform.
Friendly teams with diverse experiences and knowledge to be shared.
A fast-paced opportunity to flex your knowledge and creativity.
Opportunity to make meaningful impacts with a small team on shipping products.

You bring 

Experience implementing a modern web and mobile application.
Sharp problem-solving and analytical skills.
Able to convert product specifications into functional products.
Provide mentorship and support to fellow team members.
Takes ownership of outcomes.
Implements high-quality, full-featured software on first release.

Responsibilities Include

Develop front-end and back-end solutions for product-led opportunities.
Building a sleek and functional front-end.
Building a scalable back-end.
Debugging production issues and implementing fixes.
Embracing and continuously improving best practices shared by the whole R&D team. 

Basic Qualifications

Technical College Degree in Computer Science or Technical Certification(s) of 12+ months in total in Software Web Application Development. 
1+ year post-graduation professional experience with:
Cloud environnement (GCP/Azure/AWS)
TypeScript, React, and NodeJS
Web Application Architecture (REST, PubSub/Redis)
Preferred Qualifications (nice To Have)

Bachelor's Degree (Science or Computer Science based degree)
MERN development stack experience.
Database: MongoDB experience
Demonstrated Experience with mobile application development
React Native with Android and iOS preferred
Experience developing and supporting Kubernetes and GCP.
Experience writing automated tests.
Optimization and performance tuning MongoDB.
Meticulous cybersecurity focus by leveraging industry-recognized encryption, application architecture, and interface design.
Web application Architecture
Redis, ElasticSearch, Kubernetes, GKE, etc. 
Quickly gains business and system knowledge for a set of related components.
Contributes significantly to requirements analysis and system design.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
Thrives in a highly collaborative environment.
Disciplined at prioritizing tasks and willing to seek guidance when conflicts occur.
Additional Information

Sponsorship is not supported for this position.
Initial hybrid work model in Toronto.

RSRCAR

Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

About the job
At The Acquisition Group, a commitment to excellence is ingrained in our identity, guiding every facet of our endeavors. Our scope reaches beyond conventional software development; we are steadfast in our dedication to crafting transformative experiences, addressing complex challenges, and fostering positive global impact. In light of this, we are looking for a Junior Developer to join our team.
 
WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Develop and maintain scalable RESTful services and full-stack applications using JavaScript (ES6+), React/Redux, Node.js/Express.
Develop and ship code that is integration and end-to-end tested.
Design and implement products and solutions with high-quality, clean, maintainable, and well-documented code across the full technology stack.
Work collaboratively with all members of the team and other partners to build and ship outstanding software in a fast-paced environment.
Find opportunities for process and technology improvements, and work towards adoption and implementation.
 
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TEAM:

Degree in Computer Science, or related field, or equivalent work experience required.
3+ years of experience with front-end development (JavaScript ES6+, React/Redux).
3+ years of experience with backend, API development, and non-relational database (Node.js/Express and MongoDB).
Experience in architecting and building e-commerce platforms and applications.
Familiar with end-to-end testing.
Industry experience applying test-driven development and planning software architecture that focuses on maintainability and scalability.
Industry experience in building and maintaining distributed systems as well as working in backlogs and prioritization.
A fundamental understanding of responsive user interface design and design systems.
Experience in cross-collaboration with UX/UI designers.
Ability to work quickly and autonomously, accept and provide feedback, and receive direction.
Reliable and collaborates well with others with excellent written & verbal communication skills. 
 
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US:

Competitive compensation
Full training
Full benefits including dental, vision, and medical (after probation)
Opportunities to network and work with professionals working in the same field
This position is a 1-year term with renewal discussion after 1 year
Hybrid structure (3 days in office, 2 days remote)
 
Ready to Make Your Mark?

If you're passionate about technology, eager to learn, and ready to make a real difference, we want to hear from you. Send in your resume now to be considered for the role!
